title: TSC refactor
body:
Time series classifiers should be refactored according to the [new extension template](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/extension_templates/classification.py).

If you would like to work on this: *please post here* and which classifier you are taking on, to avoid duplication of work.
A core dev will then add your name to the classifier under refactor and/or link the PR.

Checklist of classifiers:

- [x] `BaseColumnEnsembleClassifier`
- [x] `ComposableTimeSeriesForestClassifier`
- [x] `BOSSEnsemble`, `IndividualBOSS` https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1544
- [x] `ContractableBOSS` https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1295
- [x] `MUSE` https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1359
- [x] `TemporalDictionaryEnsemble`, `IndividualTDE` https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1357
- [x] `WEASEL` https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1544
- [x] `MUSE` https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1544
- [x] `ElasticEnsemble` #1584
- [x] `ProximityForest`, `ProximityStump`, `ProximityTree` #1584
- [x] `ShapeDTW` https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1554
- [x] ~~`KNeighborsTimeSeriesClassifier`~~ (inherits from _KNeighborsClassifier and calls a version of self._fit in its current fit)
- [x] `Catch22Classifier` #1487
- [x] `MatrixProfileClassifier` https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1545
- [x] `SignatureClassifier` https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1545
- [x] `TSFreshClassifier` #1473 
- [x] `HIVECOTEV1`  #1504
- [x] `CanonicalIntervalForest` https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1269
- [x] `DrCIF` https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1269
- [x] ~~`TimeSeriesForestClassifier`~~ (bit complicated, involves the series_as_features base class)
- [x] `RandomIntervalSpectralForest` #1583
- [x] `SupervisedTimeSeriesForest` #1583
- [x] `Arsenal` https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1305
- [x] `ROCKETClassifier` https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1239
- [ ] ~~`MrSEQL`~~ (deprecated)
- [x] `ShapeletTransformClassifier` #1490

A general recipe for the refactor is as follows:

* go through all the public methods, `fit`, `predict`, etc, and change them to the new private version `_fit`, `_predict`, etc
* remove input checks (e.g., `check_X`) and output operations (e.g., set cutoff) from the private version; make sure these are already all present in the `BaseClassifier`.
* if there's an input or output check/operation that looks like it should be in `BaseClassifier` but isn't, add a note to your PR and make it very explicit; consider adding it to `BaseClassifier` but make sure @TonyBagnall  and @fkiraly are aware of such a change (ping in PR and ask for review).
* make sure all the tests pass. Don't change any of the tests. (unless there is a really good reason, in which case please explain)
* if there's an inheritance tree (not just a single class) downstream from `BaseClassifier`, make sure you do the above for all nodes in the inheritance tree
* move any "properties" or "capabilities" fields to the `_tags` dictionary.
* If new tags are added, ensure they are added to the [tag registry](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/sktime/registry/_tags.py). Look up the classifier tags (using `registry.all_tags`) before you add any new ones. Ensure @TonyBagnall and @fkiraly are aware of changes to the tag registry (ping in PR and ask for review).
